name: Great southern land?
description: Australia is often mythologised in film and TV, but national myths must not only be embraced, but resisted.

key_work.title: Great Southern Land – Icehouse
key_work.brief_description: Although it looks like it was shot in Central Australia, Icehouse’s music video for ‘Great Southern Land’ was actually filmed in a disused quarry in Sydney. A second music video was made for the song to tie-in with its use in Young Einstein.

constellations_primary.name: Great southern land?
constellations_primary.description: Australia is often mythologised in film and TV, but national myths must not only be embraced, but resisted.

start.title: Great Southern Land – Icehouse
start.brief_description: Although it looks like it was shot in Central Australia, Icehouse’s music video for ‘Great Southern Land’ was actually filmed in a disused quarry in Sydney. A second music video was made for the song to tie-in with its use in Young Einstein.

constellations_primary.name: Great southern land?
constellations_primary.description: Australia is often mythologised in film and TV, but national myths must not only be embraced, but resisted.

end.title: Young Einstein
end.creator_credit: Yahoo Serious, David Roach, Warwick Ross and Serious Productions
end.brief_description: A classic Aussie comedy based on the premise that Albert Einstein not only developed the theory of relativity but also invented rock `n’ roll.

constellations_other.name: Great southern land?
constellations_other.description: Australia is often mythologised in film and TV, but national myths must not only be embraced, but resisted.

links.description: In Yahoo Serious’ antipodean reimagining of Albert Einstein’s origin story, Icehouse’s iconic hit plays over a montage as Albert (Yahoo) departs Tasmania for the mainland. A second video clip of Icehouse’s ‘Great Southern Land’ was filmed for the film’s American release.

start.title: Young Einstein
start.creator_credit: Yahoo Serious, David Roach, Warwick Ross and Serious Productions
start.brief_description: A classic Aussie comedy based on the premise that Albert Einstein not only developed the theory of relativity but also invented rock `n’ roll.

constellations_other.name: Great southern land?
constellations_other.description: Australia is often mythologised in film and TV, but national myths must not only be embraced, but resisted.

end.title: The Man from Snowy River
end.brief_description: The Man From Snowy River, based on the classic Australian poem by Banjo Patterson, tells the story of an 18 year old boy who proves himself a man during an unforgettable chase on horseback down the rugged Snowy Mountains and becomes a legend. The most magnificent footage of horses ever filmed.

constellations_other.name: The ‘Australian' alps
constellations_other.description: These feature films and documentaries show how stories have been told to lay claim - and reclaim - the land and our national identity.

constellations_other.name: Great southern land?
constellations_other.description: Australia is often mythologised in film and TV, but national myths must not only be embraced, but resisted.

links.description: Young Einstein spoofs a number of films and one of the most iconic Australian movies to get the Yahoo Serious treatment is The Man from Snowy River, with a scene of Albert riding down a mountain much like Jim’s (Tom Burlinson) famous ride.

start.title: TERROR NULLIUS
start.material_description: Single channel video, projection, colour and audio
start.brief_description: Part political satire, eco-horror and road movie, TERROR NULLIUS is a political revenge fable that binds together a documentary impulse with speculative muckraking.

constellations_other.name: Joy of drag
constellations_other.description: The Adventures of Priscilla, Queen of the Desert is a groundbreaking Australian film with a small budget and big impact that's taken queer Australian stories to the world.

constellations_other.name: Copy, transform and combine
constellations_other.description: You will see me (2020) repurposes material sourced from the history of the moving image – archival footage, news, interviews, documentaries, reality TV, video diaries and social media – to reflect on the way we perform in front of and reveal ourselves to the camera.

constellations_other.name: Remix and resistance (Since I left you)
constellations_other.description: The Avalanches' music videos are part of a long artistic tradition of reappropriation as a means of reframing perception.

constellations_other.name: Great southern land?
constellations_other.description: Australia is often mythologised in film and TV, but national myths must not only be embraced, but resisted.

end.title: BMX Bandits
end.creator_credit: Brian Trenchard-Smith, Paul F. Davis, Tom Broadbridge and Nilsen Premiere
end.brief_description: Action filled fun entertainment, BMX Bandits stars a very young Nicole Kidman, David Argue and John Ley.

constellations_other.name: Great southern land?
constellations_other.description: Australia is often mythologised in film and TV, but national myths must not only be embraced, but resisted.

links.description: TERROR NULLIUS also dispels the myth of the man behind Mad Max. Mad Max: Fury Road‘s Furiosa (Charlize Theron), leads a female biker gang, including Nicole Kidman in BMX Bandits, against the original Max (Mel Gibson) after the audience hears Gibson’s real-life misogynist vitriol levelled at his ex-partner.

The most magnificent footage of horses ever filmed.

end.title: On the Beach
end.creator_credit: Stanley Kramer, Lomitas Productions and United Artists Corporation
end.brief_description: On the Beach is one of the most celebrated anti-nuclear films in motion picture history. Based on the novel by Nevil Shute, it is the story of US Naval commander Dwight Towers, who is sent to assist Australian authorities after the rest of the world has been devastated by a nuclear holocaust.

constellations_other.name: Great southern land?
constellations_other.description: Australia is often mythologised in film and TV, but national myths must not only be embraced, but resisted.

links.description: The Man From Snowy River is based on the short poem by Banjo Paterson, who aside from inspiring Snowy River, has over 66 soundtrack credits, including Stanley Kramer’s On the Beach, which features “Waltzing Matilda” and presents Australia as the end of the world – literally.

links.description: While The Man From Snowy River reinforces the Australian myth of the underdog, Soda_Jerk’s TERROR NULLIUS recuts and remixes Australian film and TV (including Snowy River) to resist the social, political and cultural myths that exclude our diverse national identities.

start.title: On the Beach
start.creator_credit: Stanley Kramer, Lomitas Productions and United Artists Corporation
start.brief_description: On the Beach is one of the most celebrated anti-nuclear films in motion picture history. Based on the novel by Nevil Shute, it is the story of US Naval commander Dwight Towers, who is sent to assist Australian authorities after the rest of the world has been devastated by a nuclear holocaust.

end.title: Scott no friends
end.brief_description:
This responsive display presents the moment, stories and memes capturing the zeitgeist by going viral on the internet.

PM Scott Morrison got the cold shoulder at the G20 conference in Rome. His 11th-hour plan for net-zero emissions by 2050 was criticised at home and abroad for lacking any real details, except faith that uninvented tech might save the day, and the French president labelled him a liar over the submarine fiasco. Other world leaders made their displeasure to the government’s handling of recent issues known by collectively shunning the maskless Morrison during a group photo.

constellations_other.name: Great southern land?
constellations_other.description: Australia is often mythologised in film and TV, but national myths must not only be embraced, but resisted.

links.description: While post-WWII filmmakers often imagined a world devastated by nuclear war, today the climate crisis poses a very real threat to Australia. Frustration with the Morrison government’s lack of a climate policy was expressed at the G20 meeting in 2021.

end.title: Puberty Blues
end.brief_description: Before American teen movies swamped Australia’s cinemas from the mid-1980s onwards, Puberty Blues (1981) captivated audiences with its honest and raw depiction of Australian adolescence. Not only did it explore teen social hierarchies, relationships, peer pressure and toxic machismo, it highlighted the power of female friendship and proved that chicks do surf. Based on the semi-autobiographical novel by Kathy Lette and Gabrielle Carey, the film’s authenticity can be traced to their own experience growing up on Sydney’s Cronulla beaches. Featuring a memorable soundtrack with contributions from Split Enz and trash-talking dialogue that popularised getting “dropped” and complaining about “molls”, Puberty Blues captures a unique slice of Australiana.

constellations_primary.name: Teenage dreams
constellations_primary.description: Puberty Blues realistically represents the trials and tribulations of Australian adolescence. Since then a diverse range of originals and remakes offer new perspectives on teen dreams.

constellations_other.name: Great southern land?
constellations_other.description: Australia is often mythologised in film and TV, but national myths must not only be embraced, but resisted.

links.description: Puberty Blues is based on Australia’s first coming-of-age novel written by Gabrielle Carey and Kathy Lette. It follows two teenage girls over a Sydney summer and instead of putting another Australian myth on a pedestal, it reveals the male chauvinism of the surfie subculture.
